author: Special Correspondent
text:
A parcel containing ganja, a mobile phone, a SIM card and a charger was found outside the Central Prison here on Tuesday night.

Wrapped with a tape, the packet is believed to have been flung from outside the jail to land inside the Central Prison, accommodating over 1,300 inmates. However, it hit the long boundary wall of the prison and fell outside.

The parcel was noticed by Chief Head Warder M. Kalyanasundaram while reporting for duty at around 9 p.m. on Tuesday. Sources said the packet was found lying outside the boundary wall between two watch towers situated on the northern side of jail. He handed it over to the Jailor who in turn brought the issue to the notice of the Superintendent of Prison A. Murugesan.

OThe consignment was reportedly meant for some inmate.
title: Cell phone found outside jail
